title: Megalomania
lyrics:
This is directed at what would be God, asking why we should go forth and multiply? Whatâ€™s the point?

Matt Bellamy
[Refrain]
Paradise comes at a price
That I am not prepared to pay
What were we built for?
Could someone tell me please?
[Verse 1]
The good news is she can't have babies
And won't accept gifts from me
What are they for? They'll just grow up
And break the laws you've loved
[Chorus]
Take off your disguise
I know that underneath it's me, ooh
[Post-Chorus]
Who are you?
Ooh
[Verse 2]
Useless device, it won't suffice
I want a new game to play
When I am gone, it won't be long
Before I disturb you in the dark

[Refrain]
And paradise comes at a price
That I am not prepared to pay
What were we built for?
Will someone tell me please?
[Chorus]
Take off your disguise
I know that underneath it's me
[Outro]
Woah, oh
Huh, huh
